pe_description: The Telecommunication sub-sector in Indonesia has a P/E ratio of 20.67, higher than the average IDX P/E ratio. It outperforms its last year's P/E ratio and ranks 27th among other sub-sectors in the Indonesian market. Among the companies in this sub-sector, ###PT Gihon Telekomunikasi Indonesia Tbk####, ###Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk####, and ###PT Telkom Indonesia (Persero) Tbk#### are undervalued based on their P/E ratios, while ###PT Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima Tbk.#### is overvalued and should be avoided. Some factors that could influence growth within this sub-sector include technological advancements, increasing demand for data and internet services, government regulations, and competition from other telecommunication companies.
health_description: The Telecommunication sub-sector in Indonesia, consisting of 22 companies, has shown resilience despite ranking 24th in terms of price changes in the last 30 days. Its average price changes lagged behind the IDX average. No new listings were recorded this month, with the last one occurring on 2023-07-24, indicating potential barriers to entry. Among the 22 companies, only 6 experienced positive price changes. Factors affecting the sub-sector's health index include technological advancements, regulatory changes by the Indonesian government, competition intensity, and consumer demand for telecommunication services. The Indonesian government body responsible for regulating the Telecommunication sub-sector is the Ministry of Communication and Information Technology, whose policies and decisions can significantly impact the sub-sector's resilience and overall health.
growth_description:
The Telecommunication sub-sector in Indonesia has experienced significant growth in the past year, with an average YoY quarter earnings change of 53.07% and an average YoY quarter revenue change of 3.76%. This growth has placed the sub-sector at 15th and 23rd place in terms of earnings rank and revenue rank, respectively, compared to other sub-sectors. Within the Telecommunication sub-sector, ###PT Jasnita Telekomindo Tbk.####, ###Bakrie Telecom Tbk####, and ###PT Gihon Telekomunikasi Indonesia Tbk#### are noteworthy companies with the highest YoY earning growth, YoY revenue growth, and net profit margin, respectively.

Conditions that can affect the growth of the Telecommunication sub-sector in Indonesia include changes in government regulations, technological advancements, and competition from other sub-sectors. Noteworthy regulatory changes that affect the growth of the Telecommunication sub-sector in Indonesia include the implementation of new licensing requirements, spectrum allocation policies, and data privacy regulations.
